summary: The Brothers Grimm, Jacob and Wilhelm, were German scholars who collected and published folk tales. They are famous for stories like "Cinderella," "The Frog Prince," and "Hansel and Gretel." Their first book, "Children's and Household Tales," came out in 1812. They grew up in Hanau and studied at the University of Marburg, where they became interested in German folklore. The brothers' work helped make folk tales popular again in the 1800s. Their stories have been translated into many languages and adapted for movies by filmmakers like Walt Disney.
title: Brothers Grimm
